business.headline: DreamFolks crisis explained: What's going on and what it means for investorsFounded in 2013, DreamFolks acted as a platform connecting banks, credit card companies, and passengers to airport lounges, food services, baggage handling, and other airport amenities.

Ben & Jerry's co-founder quits, accuses Unilever of silencing brand's activismBen & Jerry's co-founder Jerry Greenfield has stepped down from the company after 47 years, saying its independence to speak on social issues has been eroded under Unilever's ownership. India-US crucial trade talks begin after Donald Trump's 50% tariff moveThe Trump administration's chief negotiator, Brendan Lynch, is in India for trade discussions following Washington's decision to impose a 50% tariff on Indian goods, a move New Delhi termed "unfair, unjustified and unreasonable." The visit is an initial meeting to ease tensions, not a formal round of negotiations. This follows five previous rounds of talks. Prime Minister Narendra Modi responded to the trade situation by promising to protect local interests and stating his government would not let farmers, small entrepreneurs, or animal breeders be harmed. He also promoted a 'swadeshi' philosophy of encouraging products made in India. US President Donald Trump, while noting his friendly relationship with PM Modi, expressed disappointment over India buying Russian oil but affirmed the special relationship means there is "nothing to worry about."

One day is an insult: CAs, taxpayers slam last-minute ITR deadline extensionThe government's last-minute one-day ITR extension has ignited anger, with taxpayers and chartered accountants slamming it as tokenism, mocking portal glitches and questioning accountability in digital governance.
